name: CMIP6_transport_change_map
article_title: Future changes to the upper ocean Western Boundary Currents across two generations of climate models
citation: Sen Gupta, A. et al. Future changes to the upper ocean Western Boundary Currents across two generations of climate models. Sci Rep 11, 9538 (2021).
description: Using climate models to understand how the world’s major current systems will change in the future.

name: figure3 NH_Basline paper Figure_V5
article_title: Baseline matters: Challenges and implications of different marine heatwave baselines
citation: Smith, K. E. et al. Baseline matters: Challenges and implications of different marine heatwave baselines. Progress in Oceanography 231, 103404 (2025).
description: Explains the very different characteristics of marine heatwave evolution when using different choices of baseline definitions.

name: fire_drivers
article_title: Connections of climate change and variability to large and extreme forest fires in southeast Australia
citation: Abram, N. J. et al. Connections of climate change and variability to large and extreme forest fires in southeast Australia. Commun Earth Environ 2, 8 (2021).
description: Depicts the remote large-scale and local drivers of extreme fire in Australia.

name: hiatus
article_title: Recent intensification of wind-driven circulation in the Pacific and the ongoing warming hiatus
citation: England, M. H. et al. Recent intensification of wind-driven circulation in the Pacific and the ongoing warming hiatus. Nature Clim. Change 4, 222–227 (2014).
description: The mechanism behind the decadal pause in global warming and its relationship to changes in circulation in the tropical Pacific.

name: life at depth2 copy
article_title: Lifting the lid on Marine Heatwaves
citation: Malan, N. et al. Lifting the lid on Marine Heatwaves. Progress in Oceanography 239, 103539 (2025).
description: Life is ubiquitous throughout the ocean and so are heat extremes. Where the two meet, organisms and ecosystems can be severely affected.

name: MHW mechanisms4 copy
article_title: Lifting the lid on Marine Heatwaves
citation: Malan, N. et al. Lifting the lid on Marine Heatwaves. Progress in Oceanography 239, 103539 (2025).
description: Marine heatwaves in the subsurface ocean are driven by a variety of atmospheric and oceanic processes.

name: MHW_region_all_partitioned4
article_title: Socioeconomic impacts of marine heatwaves: Global issues and opportunities
citation: Smith, K. E. et al. Socioeconomic impacts of marine heatwaves: Global issues and opportunities. Science 374, eabj3593 (2021).
description: Some of the iconic marine heatwaves around the world, including the Blob and the Ningaloo Niño.

name: MHWpocess_imapct
citation: Holbrook, N. J. et al. Keeping pace with marine heatwaves. Nat Rev Earth Environ 1, 482–493 (2020).
description: The primary drivers of marine heatwaves, with some of their main impacts.

name: MHWtimescales
article_title: A global assessment of marine heatwaves and their drivers
citation: Holbrook, N. J. et al. A global assessment of marine heatwaves and their drivers. Nature Communications 10, 2624 (2019).
description: Marine heatwaves are driven by phenomena that act over vastly different spatial and temporal scales.

name: Pacific_Circulation
article_title: Pacific western boundary currents and their roles in climate
citation: Hu, D. et al. Pacific western boundary currents and their roles in climate. Nature 522, 299–308 (2015).
description: The Pacific Ocean circulation and its link to large-scale winds and their gradients.

name: SAM schematic_eddies
article_title: Coupled ocean-atmosphere-ice response to variations in the Southern Annular Mode
citation: Sen Gupta, A. & England, M. H. Coupled ocean-atmosphere-ice response to variations in the Southern Annular Mode. Journal of Climate 19, 4457–4486 (2006).
description: The Southern Annular Mode drives changes in ocean currents, sea ice, and eddies.

name: Schematic_MHWonShelf
article_title: Seasonal stratification and complex local dynamics control the sub-surface structure of marine heatwaves in Eastern Australian coastal waters
citation: Schaeffer, A., Sen Gupta, A. & Roughan, M. Seasonal stratification and complex local dynamics control the sub-surface structure of marine heatwaves in Eastern Australian coastal waters. Commun Earth Environ 4, (2023).
description: Drivers of different types of marine heatwave on the continental shelf off Sydney.

name: schematicsea-ice3
article_title: Combined Impacts of Southern Annular Mode and Zonal Wave Three on Antarctic Sea Ice Variability
citation: Eabry, M. D., Goyal, R., Taschetto, A. S., Hobbs, W. & Gupta, A. S. Combined Impacts of Southern Annular Mode and Zonal Wave Three on Antarctic Sea Ice Variability. Journal of Climate (2024).
description: Processes that give rise to extremes in the extent of Antarctic sea ice.

name: teleconnections
article_title: Common cause for severe droughts in South America and marine heatwaves in the South Atlantic
citation: Rodrigues, R. R., Taschetto, A. S., Gupta, A. S. & Foltz, G. R. Common cause for severe droughts in South America and marine heatwaves in the South Atlantic. Nature Geoscience 12, 620 (2019).
description: How strong convection in the tropical Indian Ocean can drive an intense compound heatwave in southern Brazil.
